parameters.name: dev-id
parameters.description: Your Terra developer ID

providers.description: Comma-separated list of providers you'd like displayed on the widget for the user. Leaving this empty will default to providers set in your dashboard settings under API > Connections

reference_id.description: An identifier to associate with the user being authenticated. This can be used to reconcile the user with your internal systems.

auth_success_redirect_url.description: URL for user redirection upon successful auth (supports deeplinks)

auth_failure_redirect_url.description: URL for user redirection upon unsuccessful auth (supports deeplinks)

language.description: The language you would like the widget to be displayed in

show_disconnect.description: Whether to show the disconnect button once the user is connected

use_terra_avengers_app.description: Whether to make use of the Terra Avengers app to authenticate users for access to Apple Health

code-samples.code:
import requests

url = "https://api.tryterra.co/v2/auth/generateWidgetSession"

payload = {
    "reference_id": "your_users_id",
    "providers": "GARMIN,WITHINGS,FITBIT,GOOGLE,OURA,WAHOO,PELOTON,ZWIFT,TRAININGPEAKS,FREESTYLELIBRE,DEXCOM,COROS,HUAWEI,OMRON,RENPHO,POLAR,SUUNTO,EIGHT,APPLE,CONCEPT2,WHOOP,IFIT,TEMPO,CRONOMETER,FATSECRET,NUTRACHECK,UNDERARMOUR",
    "language": "en"
}
headers = {
    "accept": "application/json",
    "dev-id": "testingTerra",
    "content-type": "application/json",
    "x-api-key": "ussv5SAQ53a1nNTxsMr9G41zj2KUhYMk5eDU1hjG"
}

response = requests.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers)
response.raise_for_status()

url = response.json()["url"]

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Resource (provider) to authenticate the user with. Can alternatively pass as a body parameter.

parameters.name: dev-id
parameters.description: Your Terra developer ID

reference_id.description: An identifier to associate with the user being authenticated. This can be used to reconcile the user with your internal systems.

auth_success_redirect_url.description: URL for user redirection upon successful auth (supports deeplinks)

auth_failure_redirect_url.description: URL for user redirection upon unsuccessful auth (supports deeplinks)

message.example: Current user limit has been reached

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to deauthenticate

get.description: Get activity data for the given user ID.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Id of the user to get data for

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Unix timestamp in seconds to get data since - also accepts date in YYYY-MM-DD format

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Unix timestamp in seconds to get data before - also accepts date in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional parameter - set to start_date + 1 day if not provided)

parameters.name: to_webhook
parameters.description: Whether the data should be sent to the webhook URL

parameters.name: with_samples
parameters.description: Whether the data should include samples

parameters.name: dev-id
parameters.description: Your Terra developer ID
